articles.description: DOUGLAS COUNTY — Multiple H.O.P.E. Drug Court graduate phase participants have scheduled car washes to raise money for their community projects.

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: Douglas County’s seasonally adjusted payroll employment increased by 50 jobs in April after a loss of 160 in April and a gain of 100 in March.
articles.title: Douglas County employers add 50 jobs in May

articles.description: ROSEBURG — The Roseburg Optimists will again host the annual Art Chalk event, allowing children through grade 12 to become sidewalk artists, during the Summer Arts Festival.
articles.title: Chalk Art event invites kids to become sidewalk artists

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: For Four Chaplains Memorial Foundation Legion of Honor members, joining the group is about more than just service in the armed forces. It’s about selflessness, sacrifice and serving the community.
articles.title: Vets gather in Roseburg to celebrate installation of Final Four Chaplain's Legion of Honor sign

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: For Jessica McKee, the heart and soul of her work is a combination of two things: the artistic expression of being a barista and finding inspiration in world travel.
articles.title: Wander Cafe brings international flavors, coffee classics to Roseburg

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: It is the policy of the Department of Veterans Affairs to provide care to all eligible veterans who come to them, and to provide employment to qualified staff, regardless of their political beliefs or marital status. Or is it?
articles.title: VA disputes claim of discrimination guideline changes for marital status, political beliefs and union activity

articles.author: ERICA REYNOLDS The News-Review
articles.description: Shaylene Graham and Kylee Alstadt, both second year education majors at Umpqua Community College, have been awarded $1,600 each through the Joy Malone Memorial Scholarship.
articles.title: Two win Joy Malone Memorial Scholarship

articles.description: SUTHERLIN — Each year, the Sutherlin Blackberry Festival brings in droves of attendees from near and far to view classic cars, buy goods from vendors and gather for summer fun. Now, the festival has found itself at the center of…
articles.title: Sutherlin City Manager issues public apology concerning Sutherlin Blackberry Festival, Oregon HB 3962

articles.author: Maggie Dapp The News-Review
articles.description: REEDSPORT — The city of Reedsport was fined $2,700 for water quality violations by the Oregon Department of Environmental Quality (DEQ) in May, according to a June 23 DEQ press release.
articles.title: Reedsport issued state fine for discharging raw sewage into water

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: Oregon’s unemployment rate was 4.8% in May and 4.7%in April, after rising gradually from 4.1% in May 2024.

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: On June 14, hundreds of protesters took to Northwest Garden Valley Boulevard in Roseburg to take part in the nationwide “No Kings” protest against the Trump administration. While the protest was almost entirely peaceful, with a few quickly resolved disputes…
articles.title: Roseburg Police Department take down "No Kings" flyers, sparking criticism from public

articles.description: A 20-year-old California man was seriously injured after a 40-foot fall at Toketee Falls on Monday, prompting a challenging multi-agency rescue. He was airlifted to PeaceHealth Sacred Heart Medical Center in Springfield after an hours-long operation.
